Package se.swedenconnect.spring.saml.idp.authentication.provider.external

Class AbstractUserRedirectAuthenticationProvider

java.lang.Object
se.swedenconnect.spring.saml.idp.authentication.provider.AbstractUserAuthenticationProvider
se.swedenconnect.spring.saml.idp.authentication.provider.external.AbstractUserRedirectAuthenticationProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationProvider, UserRedirectAuthenticationProvider, UserAuthenticationProvider
public abstract class AbstractUserRedirectAuthenticationProvider extends AbstractUserAuthenticationProvider implements UserRedirectAuthenticationProvider
Abstract base class implementing the UserRedirectAuthenticationProvider interface.

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractUserRedirectAuthenticationProvider

      public AbstractUserRedirectAuthenticationProvider(String authnPath, String resumeAuthnPath)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      authnPath - the path to where we redirect the user for authentication
      resumeAuthnPath - the path that the authentication process uses to redirect the user back after a completed authentication

  • Method Details

    • authenticate

      protected org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authenticate(Saml2UserAuthenticationInputToken token, List<String> authnContextUris) throws Saml2ErrorStatusException
      Will redirect to the configured authentication path (getAuthnPath()) by returning a RedirectForAuthenticationToken.
      Specified by:
      authenticate in class AbstractUserAuthenticationProvider
      Parameters:
      token - the input token
      authnContextUris - the possible authentication context URI:s
      Returns:
      an authentication token
      Throws:
      Saml2ErrorStatusException - for authentication errors

    • getTokenRepository

      public ExternalAuthenticatorTokenRepository getTokenRepository()
      The provider, or any of its subcomponents, uses an ExternalAuthenticatorTokenRepository to get hold of the RedirectForAuthenticationToken that is the input for the external authentication process. It also uses the repository to commit, or save, the result of an external authentication process (an Authentication object) before the user agent is redirected back to the Spring Security flow. These method returns the ExternalAuthenticatorTokenRepository that is used.
      Specified by:
      getTokenRepository in interface UserRedirectAuthenticationProvider
      Returns:
      an ExternalAuthenticatorTokenRepository

    • setTokenRepository

      public void setTokenRepository(ExternalAuthenticatorTokenRepository tokenRepository)
      Assigns the token repository to use (defaults to SessionBasedExternalAuthenticationRepository).
      Parameters:
      tokenRepository - the token repository

    • getAuthnPath

      public String getAuthnPath()
      Gets the path that the user agent should be redirected to in order to start the "external authentication process".
      Specified by:
      getAuthnPath in interface UserRedirectAuthenticationProvider
      Returns:
      a path

    • getResumeAuthnPath

      public String getResumeAuthnPath()
      Gets the path that is used by the "external authentication process" when redirecting the user agent back to the SAML IdP Spring Security flow.
      Specified by:
      getResumeAuthnPath in interface UserRedirectAuthenticationProvider
      Returns:
      a path
